root.thinking: There are lots of small syntactical errors that novices usually make when programming, including forgetting to include single character symbols when necessary. So a pair of brackets could be removed from a print statement, and the colon from the if statement could also be removed to introduce some syntax errors.
root.incorrect-program:
age = int(input("Enter your age: "))
# Check if the user is old enough to vote if age => 18 print("You are old enough to vote!") else: print "You are not old enough to vote yet."
root.explanation: Changed the inequality in the condition of the if statement to be => instead of >=, adding a syntax error. Removed the colon at the end of line 4, adding a syntax error. Removed the brackets from the print statement on line 7.
